summary: The document comprises records from the Assassination Records Review Board, focusing on the HSCA's staff payroll records. It details notifications about document statuses, reasons for postponing information releases, and a memorandum from Robin David Lindley advocating for a salary increase due to his significant contributions and unique qualifications. Additionally, it includes payroll authorization forms and a memorandum on payroll certification requirements, highlighting the process and its relation to Members of Congress.
key_findings: Partial postponement of the document was due to its significant historical interest and the absence of harm from release.
Postponements were mainly because of the inclusion of Social Security numbers, considered an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy.
Robin David Lindley sought a salary increase from $18,000 to $24,000 annually, based on his extensive contributions and unique expertise in law and history.
The document features various payroll authorization forms and a memorandum detailing payroll certification requirements, including connections to Members of Congress.
